intro: Solanum vernale, commonly known as the spring nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Solanum vernale is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open woodlands. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other familiar plants like tomatoes and potatoes.
